summary: This document is an email chain from August 12, 2019, forwarding a camera status report for the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) in Brooklyn. It indicates which surveillance cameras in the West and East Buildings, including the Special Housing Unit (S.H.U.), were operational at that time.

persons.name: Cnobile
persons.context: Appears as the recipient of the forwarded camera report email at the bop.gov domain.

persons.name: Electronics Technician M.D.C. Brooklyn
persons.context: Identified as the sender of the original camera status report detailing operational surveillance cameras at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.

connections.description: Cnobile is the recipient of a forwarded daily camera report authored by the Electronics Technician at MDC Brooklyn, indicating a chain of communication within the Bureau of Prisons.

events.title: Camera Status Report Generated
events.description: An Electronics Technician at MDC Brooklyn generates a report detailing which surveillance cameras in the West Building, East Building, and Special Housing Units are operational.

events.title: Camera Report Forwarded
events.description: The camera status report from August 9 is forwarded via email to a BOP email address (cnobile@bop.gov) for informational purposes.

locations: Metropolitan Detention Center (M.D.C.) Brooklyn, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a camera status report for the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, dated August 9-12, 2019.
It confirms that specific surveillance cameras in the West Building, East Building, and Special Housing Units (S.H.U.) were operational at that time.
The report was generated as a daily requirement by Communications Technicians and forwarded to BOP personnel.
The document provides specific details about the facility's surveillance infrastructure shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
